member.name: P:RootHelpers.Attribute.ControlAttribute.ControlType
member.summary: Specifies the name of an control type to associate with an input HTML field

member.name: T:RootHelpers.AlertsHelper
member.summary: The alert component is used to provide visual feedback to the user.
member.remarks: This can be used to provide the user with either confirmation messages that a record has been saved, warning messages that an error occurred, or an information message based on a system event.

member.name: M:RootHelpers.AlertsHelper.Alert``1(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper{``0},System.String,RootHelpers.Type)
member.param: if the message is empty, nothing is displayed, otherwise the alert box is displayed.
Bootstrap provides four differently styled alerts : Primary, Secondary, Success, Danger, Warning, Info, Light, Dark
member.remarks: Create a alert with Html.Alert() @Html.Alert("This is Primary info alert", RootHelpers.Type.Primary)

member.name: T:RootHelpers.BadgeHelper
member.summary: Badges are used to highlight items. Badges are numerical indicators of how many items
member.remarks: You would normally see badges to indicate the number of new or unread items, depending on the type of application.

member.summary: The Popover plugin is similar to tooltips; it is a pop-up box that appears when the user clicks on an element. The difference is that the popover can contain much more content.

member.name: M:RootHelpers.HtmlHelpers.HtmlImageThumbnail(System.String,System.Drawing.Size,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the Display Name for a model.
member.typeparam: The model's Type
member.param: The HTML Helper for the model.
member.returns: Returns the DisplayName for the model.
member.remarks:
Use the DisplayNameAttribute on your model to assign the name to be returned. Unfortunately we can not use the better/newer DisplayAttribute to specify the name because Microsoft marked it to only be used on properties, not on classes.
Use: @Html.DisplayNameFor()
